repnme.cdata!:
Tunisia - First Phase of the Education
            Quality Improvement Program (EQIP I)

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the First Phase of the
            Education Quality Improvement Program (EQIP I) in Tunisia
            were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to
            development outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: 1) The use of an adaptable
            program loan (APL) provided flexibility to the Government to
            move ahead quickly with the second phase of their 10-year
            education strategy, move some activities to the second
            phase, and to improve areas such as monitoring and
            evaluation, and involve teachers and unions in the design of
            pedagogic reforms; 2) Monitoring and evaluation systems
            should be aligned with reform programs allowing the
            monitoring of reform implementation and the development of
            evidenced-based policy decision-making; 3) In managing
            education sector reforms, involving stakeholders at key
            points of the design, implementation and evaluation of
            reforms helps build their commitment to reform programs and
            ensures that planned activities are able to be implemented
            sequentially. This is especially relevant for reforms where
            stakeholders are involved or responsible for implementation;
            4) Major pedagogic reforms such as the introduction of a
            competency-based approach aims to change significantly the
            approach and behavior of teachers in classrooms; and 5) The
            preparation of new projects in Tunisia must have prior
            discussion with the National Tender Board to apprise them of
            the procurement procedures that will be agreed upon in the
            Loan Agreement.

docna.cdata!:
Tunisia - First Phase of the Education
            Quality Improvement Program (EQIP I)

5086523.trustfund:
TF025667-PHRD-EDUCATION SECTOR PROJECT,TF030305-CANADIAN (GEN) CTF FY03 -
            EDUCATIONAL FOR ALL,TF022632-PHRD-EDUCATION SECTOR REFORM PROJECT,TF039531-TUNISIA - HIGHER EDUCATION PROJECT.,TF039608-TUNISIA:  QUALITY ENHANCEMENT PROJECT,TF030487-JAPAN CTF - FY04 GENERAL: MNA

repnme.cdata!:
Tunisia - Education Quality Improvement
            Program (EQIP) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Education Quality Improvement
            Program (EQIP) Project's objective is to support the
            government's efforts to a) achieve near-universal
            completion of basic education (Grade 1 through 9); b)
            provide a greater number of students with opportunities for
            post-basic education; and c) modernize the sector in ways
            that improve the quality of outputs and the efficiency with
            which they are produced. There are two project components.
            The first covers school-level interventions designed to
            support the government's efforts to improve the quality
            of both the teaching/learning processes and the physical
            surroundings in which basic education students learn. The
            subcomponents will a) support quality teaching innovation;
            use new information and communication technologies; extend,
            equip, and maintain school infrastructure; and reinforce
            in-service training capacity. The second component covers
            system-wide reforms aimed at strengthening evaluation and
            remediation, research, and school- and regional-level
            management capacities. The subcomponents will systematize
            assessment of students, teachers, and institutions;
            strengthen education research capacity; improve knowledge of
            the management techniques and tools of the education system;
            and regulate student flows.

docna.cdata!:
Tunisia - Education Quality Improvement
            Program (EQIP) Project

display_title.display_title:
Tunisia - Education Quality
            Improvement Program (EQIP) Project

437413.trustfund: TF039608-TUNISIA:  QUALITY ENHANCEMENT PROJECT,TF039531-TUNISIA - HIGHER EDUCATION PROJECT.,TF025667-PHRD-EDUCATION SECTOR PROJECT,TF022632-PHRD-EDUCATION SECTOR REFORM PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Tunisia - Education Quality Improvement
            Program (EQIP) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Education Quality Improvement
            Program (EQIP) Project's objective is to support the
            government's efforts to a) achieve near-universal
            completion of basic education (Grade 1 through 9); b)
            provide a greater number of students with opportunities for
            post-basic education; and c) modernize the sector in ways
            that improve the quality of outputs and the efficiency with
            which they are produced. There are two project components.
            The first covers school-level interventions designed to
            support the government's efforts to improve the quality
            of both the teaching/learning processes and the physical
            surroundings in which basic education students learn. The
            subcomponents will a) support quality teaching innovation;
            use new information and communication technologies; extend,
            equip, and maintain school infrastructure; and reinforce
            in-service training capacity. The second component covers
            system-wide reforms aimed at strengthening evaluation and
            remediation, research, and school- and regional-level
            management capacities. The subcomponents will systematize
            assessment of students, teachers, and institutions;
            strengthen education research capacity; improve knowledge of
            the management techniques and tools of the education system;
            and regulate student flows.
